definitions.text: (logic) a proposition that is accepted as true in order to provide a basis for logical reasoning

examples: He contended that Communism had no future

definitions.text: take as a given; assume as a postulate or axiom
examples: He posited three basic laws of nature

definitions.text: require as useful, just, or proper
examples: It takes nerve to do what she did
This job asks a lot of patience and skill
This position demands a lot of personal sacrifice
This dinner calls for a spectacular dessert
This intervention does not postulate a patient's consent
